#urls-ebay
[![Build Status](https://ebayci.qa.ebay.com/CI-Instance/buildStatus/icon?job=urls-ebay)](https://ebayci.qa.ebay.com/CI-Instance/job/urls-ebay)  [![security](https://nodevalid-i3ey5.vip.lvs01.dev.ebayc3.com/nodejs/urls-ebay.svg)](https://nodevalid-i3ey5.vip.lvs01.dev.ebayc3.com/nodejs/urls-ebay/)  [![Code Coverage](https://nodevalid-i3ey5.vip.lvs01.dev.ebayc3.com/coverage/nodejs/urls-ebay)](http://sonar/dashboard/index?id=urls-ebay)


Utility for URL generation & parsing

## Changelog

See   [CHANGELOG.MD](https://github.corp.ebay.com/nodejs/urls-ebay/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#changelog)

# Usage

Code example:

```javascript
var urlUtils = require('@ebay/urls-ebay');
var siteId = req.ebay.getSiteId();
var baseUrl = urlUtils.getBaseUrl(siteId);
//baseUrl will be a string similar to 'ebay.com'
```

# API
- **getBaseUrl(siteId)** - Given a siteId (int), this function will return the base url for the site and current environment.
If running in staging on the US site, this will return `qa.ebay.com`.
Staging on UK would return `uk.paradise.qa.ebay.com`

The list of supported environments and sites can be found [here](https://github.corp.ebay.com/nodejs/urls-ebay/tree/master/config)
